Authors:
João Trovão, Fabiana Soares, Diana Sofia Paiva, Nuno
Mesquita, Igor Tiago, Catarina Coelho, Lídia Catarino, Francisco Gil,
António Portugal
Title:
Mortierella hereditatis, a new Mortierella species isolated
from a biodeteriorated limestone monument in the UNESCO World Heritage
site of “University of Coimbra- Alta and Sofia”.
Abstract:
A new species, Mortierella hereditatis is here described,
for a fungus growing on a biofilm covering a deteriorated limestone wall
in the Old Cathedral of Coimbra, Portugal (UNESCO World Heritage Site).
The new species is part of the phylogenetically defined lignicola group
and related to Mortierella calciphila. Morphologically the species
produces abundant solitary chlamydospores with radiating hyphae, being
distinguished from Mortierella calciphila due to the absence of
sporangiophores and gemmae clusters. Physiologically, the species is
considered facultative alkaliphile able to endure pHs levels up to
11.
